intro: Comandra elliptica, commonly known as the narrowleaf comandra, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Comandra elliptica is noted for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally by Native American tribes.
